ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
3= Negative; 4= Positive; 5= Indeterminant; 7= Refuse to answer; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: What year did you first test positive?
Notes: YYYY. Any year from 1980 to present will be permitted. Investigators will report data if HIV status is positive.

ElementDescription: Do you take anti-HIV medicines, also called antiretrovirals, to treat your HIV?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= No, not currently; 2= Yes, currently; 7= Refuse to answer; 9= Unknown; Investigators will report data if HIV status is positive.

ElementDescription: When was the first time you ever took any antiretroviral medications to treat your HIV?
Notes: YYYY. Any year from 1987 to present will be permitted; Investigators will report data if the participant ever used ARTs.

ElementDescription: Do you take anti-HIV medications, also called pre-exposure prophylaxis or PrEP, to prevent HIV?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= No, not currently; 2= Yes, currently; 7= Refuse to answer; 8= Not applicable; 9= Unknown: Investigators will report data if HIV status is negative or unknown.

ElementDescription: When was the first time you ever took PrEP to prevent HIV?
Notes: YYYY. Any year from 2012 to present will be permitted. Investigators will report data if participant ever used PrEP.
